runs.comm: and it's a booming wide down the leg side!
punched hard to backward point where Collingwood gathers
shortish and on leg stump, Sarwan gets a bit tucked up but still squeezes it into the on side
slower ball - 73mph - and defended cautiously
and another wide, this one even further down the leg side than his first effort
clipped to short midwicket where Bopara fields
full and driven through the off side, not timed as well as it might have been, and it's pulled up in front of the Trini Posse stand
swinging white ball or not, this is amateur ... again down the leg side and a third wide
flicked off his toes square on the leg side, a hint of inside edge, but that's into a large open space
he moves to leg, Broad follows him and all Sarwan can do is push the ball into the off side for the single
hits it high off the toe-end of the bat towards deep backward square leg and Dimitri Mascarenhas holds a straightforward catch a few yards inside the boundary
steered to backward point
an easy single down to third man
overpitched, a lovely drive, threaded between mid-off and extra cover, and he's off the mark in some style
and that was as ugly as the previous shot was sublime, tries a pull but the ball hits the toe of the bat and skews into the off side
A slower ball to start with, a little short and wide, Sarwan slams that through the covers
faster and fuller, this time Sarwan leans back and hits over the top of extra cover ... the crowd are loving this but it might not last too long at this rate
fuller, driven to mid-off who is on the 30-yard circle and so there's an easy single
turned into the leg side and Shah in to field
leg-side line, Chanderpaul flicks it fine off the bottom edge and that's another boundary
chopped behind square on the off, Chanderpaul sets off for the single but the keeper is quick to gather and he has to scamper back
down the leg and a fourth wide of the innings
back, it takes him on the pad with a hint of an edge, there's a flurry of activity but they end up with a hurried run
slower and full, Chanderpaul waits and places that between two fielders in the deep behind square on the leg side
outside off, he misses but Davies fumbles the ball and they take a bye as short third man has to field
steered with an open face behind square on the off side, Collingwood at backward point can't cut it off and the man in the deep has to clear up
short, Chanderpaul looks to pull but gets a thick bottom edge into his midriff and from there into the ground
very short, he ducks, umpire Clyde Duncan waits, grins, and half signals a no-ball and then a wide ... and eventually has to signal a wide again to clear up any doubt
forced to Mascarenhas in the off side
a couple of steps and he smashes the first six of the match way over long-off, that carried by a long way
Anderson follows Sarwan as he moves to leg, he responds by running the ball down to third man
a dot ball as Chanderpaul pushes a good-length delivery back to Anderson
half driven to the off side, Anderson quickly across to gather and then swivels round to see if Sarwan has left his crease ...which he hasn't
driven to extra cover
he shapes to drive the ball down the ground but it's too short, it takes the bat high on the splice and loops to Collingwood at backward point
waits for a slower delivery, a solid push into the off side and Bopara at extra cover is deep
another slower ball - 69mph, only around 10mph more than Panesar - and defended
a third slower one turned square into the on side for a strolled single
flicked off his toes to deep backward square leg, Mascarenhas has too much ground to cover to be able to prevent the second
another slower one - it might be easier to mention the faster ones, dabbed into the off side to bring up the fifty
turned behind square, they take on the arm of Shah and the shy at the stumps misses ... Sarwan would have been safe even had his aim been better
steered to deepish midwicket
worked to short third man
short, pulled hard to backward square leg
short midwicket in quickly to field a ball dropped a few yards into the on side
spins across the batsman and down the leg side
again Collingwood at short midwicket fields as Simmons plays with the spin
squirted round the corner and far enough to the left of short fine leg to allow the single
opens the face and steers the ball to short third man
defended back to the bowler but he allows Strauss to field for him
cut hard and a great stop by a diving Collingwood at backward point
turned round the corner to Batty at short fine leg
square driven hard to point
driven hard past a diving extra cover - Bopara dives over it - and Shah fires in a good return from the deep
loud appeals as he tries to work to leg and misses
swung from outside off and into the lower tier of the stand at wide midwicket ... Shah in the deep can only watch and hope someone's going to throw the ball back
another rather optimistic appeal as he looks to play into the on side and misses
pushes into the off side and Mascarenhas from backward point fields
forward, hit on the pad outside the off-stump line
forward again and once more plays it with his pad
driven back at the bowler's feet, the ball canons off his boots into the off side, they scurry a single and a shy at the stumps misses
driven to long-on
checked drive past the bowler but this time Bopara at mid-off is in quickly to spare Mascarenhas's blushes and analysis
wristy flick through midwicket
the most open of open faces down to third man, Anderson round to stop
down to Anderson again but this time he doesn't have to break sweat as the ball goes straight to him
shapes to sweep from outside off, the ball takes him on the pad and rolls to short third man
back and whipped behind square on the leg side
driven high square on the off side, the ball bounces five yards short of Broad coming in from the cover boundary
he goes down on one knee and waits for the ball, dabbing it down to Khan at fine leg
the same shot again, this time fine enough to beat Khan who can't cut it off
defensively patted back down the pitch
chopped into the ground and from there to short third man
driven off the back foot over midwicket who jumps in the air more in hope than expectation

dropped ... punched drive, no real follow through, Khan runs in from long-on and makes a complete hash if it .. he got there and then spilt it. The crowd give a roar of delight as Khan looks for the ground to swallow him.
defensive push after that reprieve
pushed towards long-off but cut off
bottom-handed pull to Broad at long-on
flicked past a diving Collingwood at midwicket, Anderson fields in the deep
back and cuts behind square, Broad runs round to his left to field
late cut but at backward point
dances down the pitch and drives to long-on
forward and defensively turned to midwicket
a wild bottom-handed swing, aimed at long-on but it goes to deep backward  square leg
cut fine to third man where Anderson fields
driven to short extra cover, Bopara hurls the ball at the bowler's end but misses
back and driven to long-on
swished to deepish midwicket
pushed hard to Bopara at short extra cover ... he again looks as if he is about to have another shy at the stumps but thinks better of it
flicked into the on side
he opens the face as he drives, Collingwood dives but can't stop it and Sarwan comes back for a second that brings up his fifty
back and cut at Collingwood at backward point
a wild slog, a thick edge and that's four to third man
down the pitch and slammed through extra cover, enough power to beat Batty on the boundary
slower ball outside off, Sarwan aimed to pull it and was deceived by the lack of pace and missed
very short and down leg, Sarwan looks to pull and it goes over his head and that's a wide
cracked through the off side to Batty who is sweeping
a heave too far, Sarwan plays all round it and the ball clatters into middle and leg stumps
and the rarest of Twenty20 beasts, a leave outside off stump
a fiery bouncer at 85mph, that caused Bravo to flinch and it's called a wide as it was heading down the leg side
beaten outside off stump, the ball passes the inside edge as he plays back

down the leg side, a sure-fire wide had it not clipped his pad, Davies takes it well diving to his left but the appeal for the catch was not seriously considered ... Khan looked bemused but he hadn't seen that Davies had dropped it anyhow!
across his stumps and worked to mid-on, the throw from Mascarenhas hits the stumps and the batsmen momentarily thought of an overthrow
neatly flicked off his pads behind square for four ... and the crowd erupt in acclamation
turned off his pads behind square for an easy run
back and off his pads a few yards into the on side ... another relatively comfortable run
starts forward, then moves back and steers the ball to backward point
back and swatted to Pietersen at mid-off, he half stops but that's enough to prevent the single
sweetly clipped through midwicket, Bopara fires in a wild throw which deters the second run but causes Anderson to scurry to cut it off
keeps low, Bravo kills the ball
banged in short outside off stump ... that was also about three feet above the batsman's head height and why Khan looks aggrieved only he knows
heaved square on the leg side
neat clip past midwicket, Pietersen again helps earn his fee with a long chase round from deep square leg
smacked on the pads as he looks to flick the ball into the on side ... another loud appeal from Khan but the umpire having none of it and the crowd boo his affront for appealing
chipped a foot over midwicket
short, pulled square and Pietersen holds a low catch to his left
and he does just that, short and pulled over midwicket and the batsmen hug even before the ball has reached the boundary
